Qualifiers.scope: Floor Area Ratio (FAR) calculation as it pertains to basements.
applicability: Basement areas that are below grade
Basements that are habitable or non-habitable
Buildings where the top of the first floor elevation relative to grade is used in FAR determinations
exclusions: Cases where the basement contributes to the apparent mass of the building (these are not eligible for exclusion from floor area under this rule)
ambiguities: “Apparent mass” is not defined in this excerpt; criteria for determining whether a basement contributes to apparent mass are unclear.
“Grade” reference changes depending on excavated feature compliance (A vs. B), but detailed dimensional standards are not included on this page.
“Below grade” is not explicitly defined (e.g., percent/plane of grade exposure) in this excerpt.

first_floor_top_to_grade_distance.description: Vertical distance from the top of the first floor to the applicable grade reference.
first_floor_top_to_grade_distance.measurement_reference: Use grade reference A if excavated features meet standards; use grade reference B if excavated features exceed standards (see Figs 39–40 on pp. 42–43).

basement_below_grade.description: Whether the basement is below grade.

basement_habitable.description: Whether the basement is designed/used for habitation.

basement_contributes_to_apparent_mass.description: Whether the basement contributes to the apparent mass of the building.

excavated_features_compliant.description: Whether associated excavated features meet size/dimensional standards referenced in Figs 39–40 on pp. 42–43.

grade_reference.description: Grade plane used for measuring first floor distance: 'A' if compliant; 'B' if non-compliant.

first_floor_max_distance_for_basement_ex.source: FAR note (basements): Basements (even habitable ones) do not count as floor area if first floor is no more than 3' above grade.

if: first_floor_top_to_grade_distance <= 3 ft (measured to grade_reference A if excavated_features_compliant == true; otherwise to grade_reference B)
then: Basement area is excluded from total floor area (FAR calculation), regardless of basement_habitable.
notes: The FAR exclusion applies even if the basement is habitable.
Compliance is determined against size/dimensional limits in Figs 39–40 (pp. 42–43).

dependencies: Grade measurement for the 3 ft threshold depends on excavated features compliance (see separate rule on excavated features).
cross_references: Code Section 18.12.090 (a, b, c) referenced on pages 40–44
Figures 35–36 on this page for conceptual measurement references
Figures 39–40 on pp. 42–43 for dimensional standards controlling grade reference A vs B
logical: If excavated features exceed limits (non-compliant), the grade reference changes to B, which may affect whether the 3 ft threshold is satisfied.

Qualifiers.scope: Basement siting and extent standards (location and encroachment rules).
applicability: All basements associated with main dwellings
ambiguities: “Special flood hazard areas” are referenced but not defined in this excerpt (mapping/criteria not provided).
“Building footprint” definition is not provided in this excerpt (e.g., whether eaves/overhangs count).
“Required yards” and the specific conditions under which the main dwelling is permitted to extend into the rear yard are not detailed here.

in_special_flood_hazard_area.description: Whether the proposed basement location is within a special flood hazard area.

extends_beyond_building_footprint.description: Whether any part of the basement extends beyond the horizontal projection of the building footprint.

encroaches_into_required_yards.description: Whether the basement encroaches into any required yards.

yard_type.description: Type of yard into which encroachment is proposed, if any.

main_dwelling_rear_yard_extension_permit.description: Whether the main dwelling is permitted by code to extend into the rear yard.

then: Basement encroachment into the rear yard is prohibited unless main_dwelling_rear_yard_extension_permitted == true.

Exceptions: Basements may encroach into the rear yard only where the main dwelling is permitted to extend into the rear yard.

cross_references: Code Section 18.12.090 (a, b, c) referenced on pages 40–44 (specific subsections applicable to basements not fully provided in this excerpt)
logical: Rear yard encroachment permission for basements is contingent on the separate permission for the main dwelling.

Qualifiers.scope: Excavated features and their effect on grade determination and floor area measurement.
ambiguities: The exact size/dimensional standards for excavated features are not provided on this page; they are referenced to Figs 39–40 on pp. 42–43.

excavated_feature_dimensions.description: Measured dimensions of the excavated feature (e.g., length, width, depth) used to assess compliance.

excavated_features_compliant.description: Whether the excavated features meet the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39–40 on pp. 42–43.

grade_reference.description: Resulting grade reference for measuring first floor elevation and floor area purposes.

figure_references.title: Excavated feature size/dimensional limits controlling grade impact
Excavated feature & grade (illustrates grade A vs. grade B outcomes)

then: Excavation will not affect grade or measurement of floor area.
Excavation affects grade and may affect measurement of floor area.

dependencies: The grade_reference output of this rule is an input to the FAR basement exclusion rule (3 ft threshold measurement).
cross_references: Code Section 18.12.090 (c) and (c)(2) referenced on pages 41 and 44; exact standards for excavated features are on pp. 42–43, Figs 39–40.
logical: Non-compliant excavated features can change the applicable grade reference from A to B, which can in turn change whether a basement qualifies for FAR exclusion under the 3 ft threshold.
